title: Despite Poor Air Quality, Delhi T20I Will Go Ahead. Last Time Players Had To Wear Masks
text:
Despite Poor Air Quality, Delhi T20I Will Go Ahead. Last Time Players Had To Wear Masks

Despite Poor Air Quality, Delhi T20I Will Go Ahead. Last Time Players Had To Wear Masks

BCCI sources have revealed that the first T20I match between India and Bangladesh shall be played in Delhi as planned despite the poor air quality.

"We had taken permission from Delhi Pollution Control Committee and they gave November 3 as clear day so we decided to fix the Delhi venue after their consultation," BCCI sources told ANI.

"As of now everything is fixed and I don't see any change in plan," was the response when asked what would happen if the air got worse.

afp

One day after Diwali, the air quality dropped to 'very poor' according to the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research.

reuters

Bad air due to pollution has always been a concern in the capital. Back in 2017, Sri Lanka players could not breathe properly during the Test and had to wear masks on the field.

Keeping that in mind, is it a good idea to do go ahead with the game? Surely an alternative venue could be chosen. Well let's see how it unfolds and if the players are affected when they come on to field.

With Inputs From ANI.
